greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2*A156552(n) XOR A323243(n).
comment: a(n) is also the cumulative XOR of (2*A297106(d) XOR A324712(d)) over the divisors d of n.
It is conjectured that a(n) may obtain value zero only when n is a power of prime, and especially for n > 1, it must be a prime power present in A324201.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (based on Hans Havermann's factorization of A156552)
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: (PARI) A324713(n) = { my(x=0,s=0); fordiv(n,d,x = bitxor(x,A324712(d)); s = bitxor(s,A297106(d))); bitxor(x,2*s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 13 2019
